school: Johns Hopkins University Krieger School of Arts & Sciences (Advanced Academic Programs)

sections.text: The MS in Biotechnology provides a comprehensive foundation in biochemistry, molecular biology, and product development while offering tracks in enterprise, regulatory affairs, and drug discovery.
Students complete a multidisciplinary curriculum covering molecular biology, bioprocessing, regulatory science, and biotechnology enterprise, with options for flexible online and onsite study.
Applicants must hold a relevant undergraduate degree in biology or related field; the program requires core coursework and electives across biotechnology areas.
Graduates advance into biotechnology industry roles, research labs, and regulatory and policy positions.
